task_summary: Pick up the red cylindrical object from the table using a robotic arm.

task_long_description.overview: This episode demonstrates a robotic arm tasked with picking up a small red cylindrical object located on a table. The robot must perceive the object's location, approach and align above it, compute an appropriate grasp pose, grasp the object from above, and verify that it has been secured. The workspace contains additional colored objects, but only the red cylinder is the intended target. Accurate perception and gentle grasping are necessary due to the constrained environment and object arrangement.
preconditions: Red cylinder is present and clearly visible on the table surface
stepwise_plan: Check visibility of the red cylinder
Detect the red cylinder's precise location
Open the gripper to suitable width
Move to a position above the object
Compute and align to top grasp pose
Grasp the red cylinder gently from above
Verify object is in the gripper
success_criteria: Red cylinder is securely held in the gripper
Grasp is stable and object is lifted from the table
failure_and_recovery: Object not detected: retry scan up to 3 times
Grasp failed: reattempt grasping procedure or alert for manual intervention
task_long_description.termination: Episode ends when the red cylinder is lifted and held in the gripper.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if red cylinder is visible to sensors
Scans workspace in grid pattern to locate red cylinder
Runs precise object detection for red cylinder
Moves end effector above red cylinder at set height
Calculates optimal top grasp pose for red cylinder
Approaches and aligns end effector precisely above cylinder
Closes gripper with gentle force to grasp from top
Verifies that cylinder is securely held

failure_modes: Gripper closure fails to hold object
recovery_strategy: Retry scan and detection up to 3 times
Recompute grasp pose and re-approach if alignment fails
Open gripper and retry grasp if not secure
assumptions: The red cylinder depicted in the frames is mapped to 'red_cylinder'; instruction refers generically to 'red object'.
No object placement detected in episode frames; only pick operation present.
No need for explicit retreat or placement action based on episode evidence.

expected_success_criteria: Red cylinder is lifted and held without disturbance to other objects
Gripper closure confirms object securely held
